Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 11:24PM - edited Feb 9, 2011 11:28PM by Kaijah8 hmm I must have put my profile in wrong?  I didnt see anything listed under diagnosis when I looked though.  Basically the story is that I went to the doctors for two years and was tol "it was nothing" and just scar tissue.  Finally, they felt it and sent me for an ultrasound.  It was in December that I found out that I really had a tumor.  I havent had a biopsy yet and thats pretty much what I dont want to deal with.  Post have been good though.  Good to know that the numbness is not that extensive. I really hate that feeling!  I will let everyone know how my biopsy goes and I will post when I hear something!

Posts.Content: Kaijah8 wrote: I have a biopsy on Thursday and funny enough, the only thing that I am worried about is feeling numb.  I hate feeling numb.  Even when I go to the dentist, I just cant stand that feeling.  Im afraid my chest will feel funny and I will have a hard time breathing or not be able to feel my heart beat.  I know it probably seems strange, but I am looking for anyone who has had a biopsy to tell me what the feeling numb was like for you. Posts.Title: biopsy Kaijah8 CUGymGirl

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2011 07:38AM Kaijah8 wrote: I havent had my biopsy yet, but the radiologist and the doctor both told me that they have diagnosed people my age with breast cancer (I am 26), that it usually looks a little different in young woman and that it certainly had some concerning signs that they believed to be cancer.  I did some research online to find out that a majority of tumors are not cancerous, but I think its the precaution.  I had a friend who did they biopsy and was told it was not cancer but when they remove the remove, the further biopsy showed it was.  This is more of what I am concerned about - what if they are still wrong after the needle biopsy?
